MkF3jdOOgFTxDMjZN0gqLg.text: This was a great Italian restaurant with delicious food and wonderful service. We really enjoyed our food and the wait staff.  After finishing a large serving we had leftovers to take home and also took a pizza home for enjoying later.  We walked out with smiles on our faces.

Bh7c7TrtllqFdsU0wicFgA.text: I don't do reviews often but this place stood out in every way. The staff was wonderful and friendly and warm, and the food was incredible!! First time to Scotland ever and arrived on a rainy cold night, their food hit the spot and then some. 11/10 recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

bsDTOD17aw3vePxd331xsQ.text: We had a wonderful dinner here. The ambiance and the service were beyond fabulous. The wait staff were incredible, friendly, helpful, and honest.  The restaurant was very Italian.  My dinner was excellent, my husbands pasta and mushrooms were ok - the insalata was good.  We would absolutely eat here again!!!

UcONzoxT2tIhCZQFsrcMGw.text: So cute. I don't have a pic of the food because I ate every bite. Such Wonderful food and kind service.  Bolognese was spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Isctw5xrs6OBEgaznpcvdw.text: We walked in 9:45pm, and they were super friendly and said u have plenty of time., dont worry.  They have quite big meun, and free wifi. Alot of Itantian customers here too,so hopr it wd be good.  We ordered garlic cheese bread...Was not great. Wasnt hot or melted.....Now i started to worry about my main course.   Amzginly, my spaghetti carbonara .....It was sooooooo good,super hot and creamy.  sooo yummy. We also ordered scloppine(veal) al marsala. It was soo good too, but i really love my carbonara.    highly recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Very Reasonable
Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. veal masala
Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Very yummy spaghetti carbonara....Soooo good

aTyfZ2k0i3Q8r8krlrxJxA.text: Great food, convenient location to the theater district & hotels.  The standout of this location..... is the staff; they are some of the friendliest people I've ever  met period.... creating such a warm and family atmosphere that I've only experienced a small number times in years of dining out.

BnWI4snvifShqBU9TWv5qg.text: I had to write a review about this restaurant.. The food is amazing.  You  can taste that the pasta is fresh.  The price is affordable.  The staff is a bit serious but you can crack a smile from them if you start a conversation. If you are around Edinburgh you should try this family owned restaurant.  It is probably 10 minutes from the station.

iIM4nEQL4-bEDX_tFy7cGQ.text: If you are looking for a casual Italian dinner in this past of town then consider Mamma Roma. With most mains around 10 you get a tasty meal for not a lot of money. It is *casual*, not fine dining, but sometimes that suits the bill. The staff are friendly and speak to each other in Italian (if that is important to you!). The house red is distinctly drinkable and the service is fast and friendly. We walked in here on a whim before going to Wicked and ordered a pizza & a pasta, with two house reds and a coffee. The food came out in around 10 minutes and was fresh and tasty. The bill came to 30 and was provided swiftly, knowing that we were going to a show (from pleasant small talk when taking our orders). They do pre-theatre and lunch deals too. A happy smiley place - I'd go back!

sOrRndlQ9qkZfGRpqTnNBQ.text: A three course lunch menu for under 7 is always a winner in my book, and the fact that Mamma Roma's is an Italian restaurant sealed the deal for me.   This is the type of place that I love; the type of place that feels like you've just come for lunch in the kitchen of a big Italian family. We were warmly welcomed even though it was absolutely mobbed when we went, and seated pretty much straight away. The lunch menu has restricted choices, but quite a bit of variety.  I had the delicious Minestrone for starter, it was delicious with plenty of pasta in it, and then the lasagne for my main, piping hot with creamy cheese sauce...delicious. I could hardly fit a desert in, but I did my best with a portion of lemon sorbet which was really refreshing and ended the meal perfectly. All our courses were served in good time, and even though the place was busy we were attended to really well, and asked if we were ok or needed anything about three times.   I would 100% recommend the lunch menu in here, because you'll be hard pushed to find a better lunch deal in the City.

photos.caption: Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

-N72uNKiN2TneOmdi9mqfA.text: As you can see from the picture, these guys do old school Italian so i don't need to go into great detail about the look of the place.  I'll get straight to the food, first trip I had one of the specials, Mezze Lune. Little pasta pockets stuffed with goats cheese in a creamy tomato sauce. Yummy.  Second trip, we couldn't get a table. Waited for 20 minutes then left.  Third trip I had Fieleto Diana, which was 18 but they gave me like half a cow served with a sweet onion sauce.  This place is pricey, but you're paying for the extra effort they put into the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mamma Roma Restaurante - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

gDxz2oeXJ3NZwNJjm8-UxA.text: This is really your average run-of-the-mill Italian restaurant. We made a reservation, but really did not need it. There was only one other party at the restaurant when we got there, though it may be busier with playhouse traffic. As for food, the prices are reasonable, the food was good (but nothing great or unusual) and the service was fine. The decor and music in the restaurant was a little cheesy. Though the food was good, I don't think I would waste my time going back there again as there are plenty of great restaurants in Edinburgh to go to instead.

HS3WuBCWhNP5FZv98ZFaSg.text: Central, overpriced and quasi Italian, that is Mama Roma. Its personnel treats you more like a takeaway customer than a restaurant guest. The menu contains most of the popular Italian dishes, however, most of them come in small postions, especially the starters, and have bland taste due to improper cooking. Perhaps the management wants to get by thin and buys the cheapest ingredients possible. On top of that, the prices are True rip off for the quality you get.
